title: Did Mac Miller inspire you to be a rapper? - Quora

response.answer_text: I guess in a way, but not really. I don't have a solid one person that influenced me to be an emcee. There are, however, multiple rappers who've influenced me in certain (somewhat specific) ways. I wouldn't put Mac in the top rappers that inspired me. But his mixtape “Faces” influenced me by making it comfortable for me to rap about mental health, internal struggles, etc. (Which i incorporate in a few rhymes). Another, more prominent rapper, that influenced me in the same fashion as well as many other ways is Kanye. But anyways, I wouldn't say i started rapping bc of Mac Miller. But that doesnt take away of how great of a rapper he is, and he being one of my favorite rappers.

Yes he definitely did. His albums good am, best day ever, and watching movies with the sound off were some of the many inspiring albums that I had on repeat during my psychadelic phase right before I started rapping seriously. His Good AM concert at Rialto theater in Tucson, AZ was one of the best concerts I have ever had the pleasure of attending. Mac definitely was a genuine dude who loved making music and I could tell that he really cared about his fans. He definitely inspired me to be a rapper and will be missed. RIP Mac :,) hes probably smoking a blunt in the clouds somewhere

Dear, concerned person No. Also you realize that he's a white rapper soooooo I ain't got no respect for that. And I don't give a fuck how big he is or he isn't I don't really know him but for the thousand TIME WHITE PEOPLE SHOULD LEAVE RAP IT'S OURS WE MADE IT AND STOP STEALING IT SO YOU COULD POP. Sincerely, Jay.
No, not by a long shot!!!!!
